description: Unique identifier for the work code record; primary key used to link this code to work orders and related tables.
System timestamp of the most recent change to this work code record (format likely YYYYMMDDHHMMSSmmm); used for audit and synchronization.
Human-readable title describing the maintenance/repair task or recall associated with the work code.
Short alphanumeric code for the work item, used for entry, search, and reporting on work orders.
Free-text instructions or remarks for performing the task, such as checks, lubrication, or parts replacement.
Numeric reference to the work order type/category this code belongs to; joins to a work order type lookup.
Lookup source indicator for wotype (likely the referenced table or domain); confirm with SME.
Identifier for this work code in the legacy system to support data migration and cross-reference; may be null.
Name of the source table in the legacy system from which this code originated; aids traceability.
Code indicating what action to take if the related inspection or task fails; meaning of specific values is unclear and should be confirmed with SME.
Boolean flag indicating all associated checks/subtasks must pass for the work item to be considered successful.
Boolean flag indicating this work code applies only to specified service/vehicle classes; when true, eligibility is restricted.
Boolean flag marking the work code as inactive/unavailable for new work orders while preserving history.
Boolean flag indicating this is the default code selected for the associated context or work type.
